title: Majority coalition in parliament forms government

content.question: In a parliamentary system, a minimum winning coalition refers to

choices.label: an alliance of elite factions in one-party systems
an alliance of opposition parties formed following new elections
the smallest number of parties necessary to command a majority in an assembly
the smallest number of parties to have won seats in an assembly
a special legislative committee needed for the development of a particular bill

content.answer: the smallest number of parties necessary to command a majority in an assembly

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
